DataElement.preferredName: Prior Investigational New Drug Administration Half Life Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether a patient meets the criteria for enrolling onto a clinical trial for questions related to the amount of time needed for a material to lose half of its physical, chemical, or biological activity for the prior administration of new drugs or biological drugs that are used in a clinical investigation as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Investigational New Drug Administration Half Life Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The amount of time needed for a material to lose half of its physical, chemical, or biological activity._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

Concepts.definition: A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

Property.preferredName: Administration Half Life Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:The amount of time needed for a material to lose half of its physical, chemical, or biological activity.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
The amount of time needed for a material to lose half of its physical, chemical, or biological activity.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have at least 5 half-lives el
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 5 half-lives elapsed from any prior investigational agent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 5 half-lives elapsed from investigational agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received prior investigational agents, have at least 5 half-lives or two weeks (whichever is shorter)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received treatment with an investigational agent has a minimum of 3 months or 5 half-lives of the compound, which ever is greater, elapsed form the last  treatment date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior experimental (non-FDA approved) therapy or immunotherapies, this therapy was last administered more than 30 days or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is less) prior to the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior experimental (non-FDA approved) therapy (other than drugs that target ATR) and Immunotherapies, this therapy was last administered more than 30 days or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is less) prior to the initiation of study treatment?
